title: Wayne Rooney posts tribute video after breaking record - and it looks like he's knocked it up himself on PowerPoint
text:

Wayne Rooney was in a rather jolly mood after breaking Sir Bobby Charlton's record to become Manchester United's all-time record goal scorer. 
So much so in fact he switched on his old PC, powered up Microsoft PowerPoint and set about creating this little beauty you can see in the above video. 
OK, we can't say for sure that this indeed happened - the clip was most likely put together by someone else - but we hope it did. 
The video is a collection of photos from the striker's career, documenting everything from the day he first posed next to Sir Alex Ferguson with a United shirt to a recent shot of him clapping. Wayne Rooney reminding the Everton fans what they're missing in his first game after leaving (Photo: John Peters/Manchester United/Getty) 
It's great and all that, as in it does the job. 
And looks brilliant next to Rooney's little note: "Would like to thank all the staff and teammates I have played with at Manchester United for helping me reach 250 goals. 
"I couldn't have done it without you!" The goal that made history (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) Where it all began (Photo: Getty) 
But still, there's just something about it that will bring a little smirk to your face. 
Maybe it's the interesting choice of backing music? Maybe it's the zoom-in-zoom-out transitions applied to EVERY picture? Maybe it's the rather random choice of images? 
Who knows... but it is pretty funny. Like us on Facebook
